intro: Eysenhardtia officinalis, commonly known as the California poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its striking orange to red flowers and smooth, hairless stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant relies on wind pollination. Eysenhardtia officinalis is well adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in open fields and along roadsides.
